metadata.synopsis:
These paladins signed their pact with Zariel for riches and power and serve her with relish. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters.

This cultist is the leader of the group. He's friendly, but badly injured after his fight with Karlach.

21.speaker: Anders
21.text: I thank you for taking our side. You had no reason to trust us, yet your faith spared us a grisly end.
21.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

15.speaker: Anders
15.text: Our lord Tyr sent us in pursuit of that devil. She had already butchered a family fleeing the armies of the Absolute by the time we caught up with her.

145.speaker: Anders
145.text: She bested us once, and would have finished the job if not for you.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Why did she think you agents of Zariel?

6.speaker: Anders
6.text: I suppose she sought cover for her own crimes by accusing us.

139.speaker: Anders
139.text: But she's dead now. She can't hurt anyone anymore. You are our protector - Tyr's blessings are upon you.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: It was my duty to protect you.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Maybe I was too hasty. Maybe she was right about you.

53.speaker: Anders
53.text: She wasn't. Let me prove it to you with a gift.

19.speaker: Anders
19.text: She wasn't. I may not be able to convince you, but Tyr's blessing is now upon you. Let him strike me down if I take his word in vain.

26.speaker: Anders
26.text: Our scouts told us you'd come. The devil's ally. Come to finish us, have you?
26.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You must mean Karlach. I know the truth about who you are.
30.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

62.speaker: Anders
62.text: I'm sure she's invented a fascinating history of our crimes. The truth is far simpler.
62.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

82.speaker: Anders
82.text: We are paladins of Tyr, Lord of Justice. He sent us after an infernal being, straight out of the Nine Hells, hiding in the form of a one-horned tiefling - Karlach.
82.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

4.speaker: Anders
4.text: She's slaughtered countless refugees fleeing the Absolute. Yesterday, she butchered an entire family. We were lucky to survive our encounter with her.
4.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Say I buy your story. What then?
99.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

88.speaker: Anders
88.text: Then you'd be very stupid indeed.
88.context: NodeContext: HE suddenly drops the 'woe is me' act.

147.speaker: Player
147.context: NodeContext: the mask drops; he reveals his true nature. not a suffering paladin but an agent of evil

78.speaker: Anders
78.text: First I was burned within in inch of my life, and now I'm stuck playing pantomime. I can't take it anymore.
78.context: NodeContext: the mask drops; he reveals his true nature. not a suffering paladin but an agent of evil

120.speaker: Anders
120.text: Karlach is going back to Avernus, and if she won't go quietly, she dies. It looks like I'll have to kill you first, which I quite look forward to. Bye-bye.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: If you serve the Lord of Justice, prove it. Recite the Creed of the Left Hand.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: That depends on you. Are you what she says you are?
91.context: NodeContext: The jig is up and Anders' demeanor changes. He drops the veil of the lie of the kindly paladin and reveals himself for what he is

109.speaker: Player
109.text: That's right. I'm sending you back to Avernus where you belong.
109.context: NodeContext: The jig is up and Anders' demeanor changes. He drops the veil of the lie of the kindly paladin and reveals himself for what he is

134.speaker: Anders
134.text: Tsk. Poor Karlach. Allied with the first sap she met, who will be so quickly destroyed.
134.context: NodeContext: The jig is up and Anders' demeanor changes. He drops the veil of the lie of the kindly paladin and reveals himself for what he is

40.speaker: Anders
40.text: Zariel will find this all terribly funny.

58.speaker: Anders
58.context: NodeContext: enthusiastically greeting a player he believes is a fellow cultist

65.speaker: Anders
65.text: Your actions saved many souls - Tyr be with you.
65.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

68.speaker: Anders
68.text: Wh-who's there? Please - keep your distance. You're welcome to shelter here, but we've grave injuries to tend to.
68.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

89.speaker: Player
89.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

116.speaker: Anders
116.text: A devil - the most deadly foe we've yet encountered.
116.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

137.speaker: Anders
137.text: We are paladins of Tyr, Lord of Justice. He sent us after an infernal being, straight out of the Nine Hells, hiding in the form of a one-horned tiefling.
137.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

87.speaker: Player
87.text: One horn? Then you mean Karlach. Archdevil's bootlicker.
87.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: One horn? Then you mean Karlach. Archdevil's bootlicker.
107.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

45.speaker: Player
45.text: *One horn. He means Karlach - there is no doubting it.*
45.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *One horn. He means Karlach - there is no doubting it.*
96.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

130.speaker: Anders
130.text: You know her. Which means you know what the fiend's capable of.
130.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *That's Karlach all right. If you believe her story, these so-called paladins are lying.*
39.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

118.speaker: Anders
118.text: She's slaughtered countless refugees fleeing the Absolute. Yesterday, she butchered an entire family without mercy.
118.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

113.speaker: Anders
113.text: We were lucky to survive our encounter with her.
113.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

33.speaker: Player
33.text: *This could be the work of a devil, but they collect souls through cunning, not carnage.*
33.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

149.text: *This could be the work of a devil, but they collect souls through cunning, not carnage.*
149.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: *This could be the work of a devil, but they collect souls through cunning, not carnage.*
128.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

152.speaker: Player
152.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

9.speaker: Anders
9.text: She ran toward the river when she saw we were merely wounded - not dead. Down the hill from here.

135.speaker: Anders
135.text: She must pay for her crimes. If you capture her, you will have served Tyr where we could not.

108.speaker: Anders
108.text: This is the Sword of Justice, blessed by Tyr. I've wielded it since I swore my oath.

1.speaker: Anders
1.text: It's all I have, but it's yours if you stop her. Bring me her head, and Tyr will consider her crimes repaid.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Very well. I'll bring you her head.

123.speaker: Anders
123.text: May the Just God guide you.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I have other things to deal with.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: The only head that will roll is yours.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: It isn't like a devil to use their brawn instead of their brains.
20.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

155.speaker: Anders
155.text: Indeed. She's a uniquely vicious case. All the more reason she must be stopped.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Truly? I believe I've met her.
11.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

106.speaker: Anders
106.text: Then you're lucky to be alive.
106.context: NodeContext: surprised on first sentence, then determined - Zariel is the arch-devil he serves

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I've already dealt with her. She's dead.
14.context: NodeContext: He's just been told the fiend he hunts is dead. Surprise and hope.

70.speaker: Anders
70.text: If that's true, this is the first glimmer of hope we've had for a long while. But I'll need proof.
70.context: NodeContext: He's just been told the fiend he hunts is dead. Surprise and hope.

48.speaker: Anders
48.text: Bring me her head, and I'll give you my blade. It carries Tyr's blessing - and you will have earned it by carrying out his justice.
48.context: NodeContext: Making a reasonable bargain. 'Tyr' (TEER) is his god

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Let me help. I can hunt down this monster.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: I wish you and yours well, but I must be on my way soon.

77.speaker: Anders
77.text: I understand. But if you see the fiend, be on your guard. She's dangerous.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I've met her. She said you were servants of Zariel sent to take her back to Avernus.

12.speaker: Anders
12.text: A devilish lie. She nearly killed me with her hellacious flames, and now she's sent you to finish the job.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I've been called a devil before. Are you sure this tiefling is what you say?

56.speaker: Anders
56.text: The fiend may have been a tiefling once, but she belongs to Avernus now. I wish it were not so, and I bear no grudge against your people.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Truth and justice, brother. My oath is in Tyr's name. I am sorry to hear about the fate of your mission.

93.speaker: Anders
93.text: A fellow paladin? What fortune. You might be able to succeed where we failed.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Now that she softened you up, I'll finish you off.

84.speaker: Anders
84.text: Fool. All you'll get is a broken skull.

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *You recognise the description - the burning tiefling you met by the river.*

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I heard a tiefling called Karlach nearly roasted you to death.

55.speaker: Anders
55.text: Believe me, she's no tiefling, but a devil. We were lucky to escape.

54.speaker: Anders
54.text: Just yesterday, the devil Karlach slaughtered countless refugees. An entire family met their end at her hands - including a pregnant mother.

97.speaker: Anders
97.text: A tollhouse, once upon a time. Now a house of respite for those of us burned by a devil.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Cut the act. I know what you are. Agents of Zariel here to collect an asset.

102.speaker: Anders
102.text: Agents of... let me guess. The devil Karlach herself told you that profane lie.

17.speaker: Anders
17.text: We are paladins of Tyr, sworn to protect those in need. He sent us to hunt Karlach down, but she was too vicious for us.

129.speaker: Anders
129.text: Look at me. The devil nearly burned me to the bone. A tiefling couldn't do that without powerful magics. She's something far worse.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Say I buy your story. What then?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I disagree. I think you're something far worse.

47.speaker: Anders
47.text: Believe what you will, but do it in silence. We have wounded to tend to - and a return home to plan.

80.speaker: Anders
80.text: It isn't too late to do the right thing, though.

142.speaker: Anders
142.text: Before you go - I wouldn't be a proper paladin if I didn't try to enlist your help in a righteous battle.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: If you serve the Lord of Justice, prove it. Recite the Creed of the Left Hand.

131.speaker: Anders
131.text: To arms, comrades. We are discovered.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Rest easy. I'll only stay a short time.

51.speaker: Anders
51.text: Tyr protect you. Be on your watch. There's a devil in the guise of a one-horned tiefling haunting the Risen Road.

83.speaker: Anders
83.text: She's dead. Finally we can rest.

105.speaker: Anders
105.text: You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.

74.speaker: Anders
74.text: But here is my blade, blessed by Tyr. I hope it keeps you safe, and brings your enemies to justice.

73.speaker: Anders
73.text: We owe you every gratitude. If we had something - anything - to give, we would. But our thanks - and Tyr's gratitude - will have to suffice for now.

136.speaker: Anders
136.text: Bless you in all your doings - in Justice's name.

85.speaker: Anders
85.text: Perhaps you've decided to chase down the fiend after all?
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Attach sword of justice to waistNodeContext: enthusiastically greeting a player he believes is a fellow cultist

124.speaker: Anders
124.text: Any sign of the tiefling fiend?
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Attach sword of justice to waistNodeContext: enthusiastically greeting a player he believes is a fellow cultist

150.speaker: Player
150.text: She's dead, but I couldn't retrieve her head.
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Martin K - Player takes out Karlach's decapitaded head, tosses on ground

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Here's her head. Just like you asked.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Martin K - Player takes out Karlach's decapitaded head, tosses on ground

35.text: You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Martin K - Player takes out Karlach's decapitaded head, tosses on ground

127.speaker: Anders
127.text: You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Martin K - Player takes out Karlach's decapitaded head, tosses on ground

28.text: You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Martin K - Player takes out Karlach's decapitaded head, tosses on ground

36.speaker: Anders
36.text: You've saved our souls. It's a debt that can never truly be repaid.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.NodeContext: shows his sword

71.speaker: Anders
71.text: But here is my blade, blessed by Tyr. I hope it keeps you safe, and brings your enemies to justice.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.NodeContext: shows his sword

50.speaker: Anders
50.text: Thank you. As promised, here is my blade, blessed by Tyr.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.NodeContext: with reverence - he's passing us a holy weapon, with awe and regret to be losing it

143.speaker: Anders
143.text: It's sacred... the most valuable thing I've ever held. I hope it serves you as well as it served me.
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Takes out his sword, and presents it to player, player takes sword.NodeContext: with reverence - he's passing us a holy weapon, with awe and regret to be losing it

126.speaker: Anders
126.text: A grim business - but justice has been served. May Tyr watch over you.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Remind me - how will I recognise her?
110.context: NodeContext: impatient, describing a fearsome adversary

95.speaker: Anders
95.text: She only has one horn, and she looks like she could rip your arms off with her bare hands. Hard to miss.
95.context: NodeContext: impatient, describing a fearsome adversary

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I met her. She says you're the fiends, and I believe her.
5.context: NodeContext: Delighted on first word - then enthusiastic and determined

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I met her by the river, not far from here.
76.context: NodeContext: Delighted on first word - then enthusiastic and determined

0.speaker: Anders
0.text: But she's still alive? We need her head.
0.context: NodeContext: Delighted on first word - then enthusiastic and determined

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Drop the act - you're no paladin. You serve the archdevil Zariel.
